org.gearvrf

Class GVRTexture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRHybridObject
      • org.gearvrf.GVRTexture
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRBitmapTexture, GVRCompressedCubemapTexture, GVRCompressedTexture, GVRCubemapTexture, GVRExternalRendererTexture, GVRExternalTexture, GVRFloatTexture, GVRRenderTexture, GVRSharedTexture

    public class GVRTexture
extends GVRHybridObject
    Wrapper for a GL texture.

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Deprecated. 
        Get the ID generated by glGenTextures(). Do not use this in loops as each and every call will wait for about 16ms.
        Returns:
        The GL ID of the texture.

      • getAtlasInformation

        Returns the list of atlas information necessary to map the texture atlas to each scene object.

        List of atlas information.

      • setAtlasInformation

        public void setAtlasInformation(java.util.List<GVRAtlasInformation> atlasInformation)
        Set the list of GVRAtlasInformation to map the texture atlas to each object of the scene.
        Parameters:
        atlasInformation - Atlas information to map the texture atlas to each scene object.

      • isAtlasedTexture

        public boolean isAtlasedTexture()
        Inform if the texture is a large image containing "atlas" of sub-images with a list of GVRAtlasInformation necessary to map it to the scene objects.
        Returns:
        True if the texture is a large image containing "atlas", otherwise it returns false.

      • setTexCoords

        public void setTexCoords(java.lang.String vertexTexCoord,
                         java.lang.String shaderVariable)
                  throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the name of the texture coordinate vertex attribute to use for this texture and what shader output is is assigned to. This allows a texture to be used with any set of texture coordinates from a mesh. Initially this parameter is null. You may set it once but then it cannot be changed afterwards. This is because it is used to generate code for the fragment shader and updating it would require the shader to be recompiled.
        Parameters:
        vertexTexCoord - string with name of texture coordinate attribute in vertex.
        shaderVariable - string with name of shader variable to get the texture coordinates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if you change variables more than once.

      • getVertexTexCoord

        public java.lang.String getVertexTexCoord()
        Gets the name of the texture coordinate vertex attribute to use for this texture. This allows a texture to be used with any set of texture coordinates from a mesh.
        Returns:
        name of texture coordinate attribute

      • getShaderTexCoord

        public java.lang.String getShaderTexCoord()
        Gets the name of the shader variable used to store texture coordinates for this texture. This allows a texture to be used with any set of texture coordinates from a mesh.
        Returns:
        name of texture coordinate shader variable
